info.description:
The Patient Access API includes adjudicated claims data, encounters with capitated providers, and clinical data, including laboratory results, formulary information or information about covered outpatient drugs and preferred drug lists must be viewable to the member.

Claims and Encounter data focuses on the FHIR Resources that aligns to CARIN for Blue Button implementation guide based on HL7 FHIR specification, which payers can display to consumers via a FHIR API.
More information on each resource's response attributes may be found in the CARIN for Blue Button HL7 FHIR specification at the link below. 

[https://hl7.org/fhir/us/carin-bb/STU1/index.html](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/carin-bb/STU1/index.html)

Clinical data focuses on the FHIR Resources that represent core clinical information for a patient. The information contained in these Resources are those frequently documented, created or retrieved by healthcare providers during the course of clinical care. Resources generated during the course of diagnostic studies can be found in the Diagnostics Module, whereas the Resources related to medication ordering and administration process can be found in the Medications Module. 

[https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/index.html](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/index.html)
info.title: PatientAccess API

A [US-Core-Location](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-location.html) is details and position information for a physical place where services are provided and resources and participants may be stored, found, contained, or accommodated.

The `US-Core-Location` FHIR [implementation guide](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/index.html) contains complete details.

Reference the FHIR specification for detailed `US-Core-Location` [attribute descriptions](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-location-definitions.html) and [sample response](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/Location-hl7east.json.html)

The `US-Core-Encounter` FHIR [implementation guide](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/index.html) contains complete details.

A [C4BB-Coverage](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/carin-bb/STU1/StructureDefinition-C4BB-Coverage.html) is the Data that reflect a payer’s coverage that was effective as of the date of service or the date of admission of the claim.

The `C4BB-Coverage` FHIR [implementation guide](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/carin-bb/STU1/index.html) contains complete details.

Reference the FHIR specification for detailed `C4BB-Coverage` [attribute descriptions](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/carin-bb/STU1/StructureDefinition-C4BB-Coverage-definitions.html) and
[HL7 Bundle](https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/bundle.html) attribute descriptions.

The `US-Core-DiagnosticReport` FHIR [implementation guide](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/index.html) contains complete details of the below profiles,


1. US-Core-DiagnosticReport-Note
2. US-Core-DiagnosticReport-Lab

A [US-Core-DiagnosticReport-Note](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-diagnosticreport-note.html) is the findings and interpretation of diagnostic tests performed on patients, groups of patients, devices, and locations, and/or specimens derived from these. The report includes clinical context such as requesting and provider information, and some mix of atomic results, images, textual and coded interpretations, and formatted representation of diagnostic reports.

Reference the FHIR specification for detailed `US-Core-DiagnosticReport-Note` [attribute descriptions](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-diagnosticreport-note-definitions.html) and [HL7 Bundle](https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/bundle.html)


A [US-Core-DiagnosticReport-Lab](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-diagnosticreport-lab.html)  Laboratory results are grouped and summarized using the DiagnosticReport resource which typically reference Observation resource(s). Each Observation resource represents an individual laboratory test and result value or component result values, or a “nested” panel (such as a microbial susceptibility panel) which references other observations. They can also be presented in report form or as free text.

Reference the FHIR specification for detailed `US-Core-DiagnosticReport-Lab` [attribute descriptions](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-diagnosticreport-lab-definitions.html) and [HL7 Bundle](https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/bundle.html).

Success response will be HL7 `Bundle` with `DiagnosticReport` resource type of `US-Core-DiagnosticReport`.


**Warning:**
Attribute `__id` with value `giztmotwmvzhg2lpnyxtclrshjygc5djmvxhillbmnzs44dsnfzw2ltznvwa` is ***required*** for prototyping only.

A [US-Core-Organization](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-organization.html) is a formally or informally recognized grouping of people or organizations formed for the purpose of achieving some form of collective action. Includes companies, institutions, corporations, departments, community groups, healthcare practice groups, payer/insurer, etc.

The `US-Core-Organization` FHIR [implementation guide](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/index.html) contains complete details.

The [US-Core-PractitionerRole](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-practitionerrole.html) describes details about a provider, which can be a practitioner or an organization. When the provider is a practitioner, there may be a relationship to an organization. A provider renders services to patients at a location. When the provider is a practitioner, there may also be a relationship to an organization. Practitioner participation in healthcare provider insurance networks may be direct or through their role at an organization.

A [US-Core-DocumentReference](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-documentreference.html) resource is used to index a document, clinical note, and other binary objects to make them available to a healthcare system. A document is some sequence of bytes that is identifiable, establishes its own context (e.g., what subject, author, etc. can be displayed to the user), and has defined update management. The DocumentReference resource can be used with any document format that has a recognized mime type and that conforms to this definition.

The `US-Core-DocumentReference` FHIR [Implementation Guide](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/index.html) contains complete details 

Reference the FHIR specification for detailed `US-Core-DocumentReference` [attribute descriptions](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-documentreference-definitions.html) and [HL7 Bundle](https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/bundle.html).Success response will be HL7 `Bundle` with `DocumentReference` resource type of `US-Core-DocumentReference`.

The `US-Core-Provenance` FHIR [implementation guide](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/index.html) contains complete details.

An [US-Core-Immunization](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-immunization.html) describes the event of a patient being administered a vaccine or a record of an immunization as reported by a patient, a clinician or another party. 

The `US-Core-Immunization` FHIR [implementation guide](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/index.html) contains complete details.

Reference the FHIR specification for detailed `US-Core-Immunization` [attribute descriptions](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-immunization-definitions.html) and [sample response](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/Immunization-imm-1.html).

The `ExplanationOfBenefit` FHIR [implementation guide](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/carin-bb/STU1/index.html) contains complete details of the below profiles,


1. C4BB-ExplanationOfBenefit-Inpatient Institutional
2. C4BB-ExplanationOfBenefit-Outpatient Institutional
3. C4BB-ExplanationOfBenefit-Pharmacy
4. C4BB-ExplanationOfBenefit-Professional NonClinician


A [C4BB-ExplanationOfBenefit-Inpatient Institutional](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/carin-bb/STU1/StructureDefinition-C4BB-ExplanationOfBenefit-Inpatient-Institutional.html) profile is used for Explanation of Benefits (EOBs) based on claims submitted by clinics, hospitals, skilled nursing facilities and other institutions for inpatient services, which may include the use of equipment and supplies, laboratory services, radiology services and other charges. Inpatient claims are submitted for services rendered at an institution as part of an overnight stay. The claims data is based on the institutional claim format UB-04, submission standards adopted by the Department of Health and Human Services.

Reference the FHIR specification for detailed `C4BB-ExplanationOfBenefit-Inpatient Institutional` [attribute descriptions](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/carin-bb/STU1/StructureDefinition-C4BB-ExplanationOfBenefit-Inpatient-Institutional-definitions.html) and [HL7 Bundle](https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/bundle.html).




A [C4BB-ExplanationOfBenefit-Outpatient Institutional](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/carin-bb/STU1/StructureDefinition-C4BB-ExplanationOfBenefit-Outpatient-Institutional.html) profile is used for Explanation of Benefits (EOBs) based on claims submitted by clinics, hospitals, skilled nursing facilities and other institutions for outpatient services, which may include including the use of equipment and supplies, laboratory services, radiology services and other charges. Outpatient claims are submitted for services rendered at a Institutional that are not part of an overnight stay. The claims data is based on the institutional claim form UB-04, submission standards adopted by the Department of Health and Human Services.

Reference the FHIR specification for detailed `C4BB-ExplanationOfBenefit-Outpatient Institutional` [attribute-descriptions](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/carin-bb/STU1/StructureDefinition-C4BB-ExplanationOfBenefit-Outpatient-Institutional-definitions.html) and [HL7 Bundle](https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/bundle.html).




A [C4BB-ExplanationOfBenefit-Pharmacy](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/carin-bb/STU1/StructureDefinition-C4BB-ExplanationOfBenefit-Pharmacy.html) profile is used for Explanation of Benefits (EOBs) based on claims submitted by retail pharmacies. The claims data is based on submission standards adopted by the Department of Health and Human Services defined by NCPDP (National Council for Prescription Drug Program)

Reference the FHIR specification for detailed `C4BB-ExplanationOfBenefit-Pharmacy` [attribute-descriptions](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/carin-bb/STU1/StructureDefinition-C4BB-ExplanationOfBenefit-Pharmacy-definitions.html) and [HL7 Bundle](https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/bundle.html).




A [C4BB-ExplanationOfBenefit-Professional NonClinician](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/carin-bb/STU1/StructureDefinition-C4BB-ExplanationOfBenefit-Professional-NonClinician.html) profile is used for Explanation of Benefits (EOBs) based on claims submitted by physicians, suppliers and other non-institutional providers for professional services. These services may be rendered in inpatient or outpatient, including office locations. The claims data is based on the professional claim form 1500, submission standards adopted by the Department of Health and Human Services as form CMS-1500.

Reference the FHIR specification for detailed `C4BB-ExplanationOfBenefit-Professional NonClinician` [attribute-descriptions](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/carin-bb/STU1/StructureDefinition-C4BB-ExplanationOfBenefit-Professional-NonClinician-definitions.html) and [HL7 Bundle](https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/bundle.html).

Success response will be HL7 `Bundle` with resource type of `ExplanationOfBenefit`.

**Warning:**
Attribute `__id` with value `giztmotwmvzhg2lpnyxtclrshjygc5djmvxhillbmnzs44dsnfzw2ltznvwa` is ***required*** for prototyping only.

A [US-Core-Patient](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-patient.html) is demographics and other administrative information about an individual or animal receiving care or other health-related services.

A [US-Core-MedicationRequest](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-medicationrequest.html) is an order or request for both supply of the medication and the instructions for administration of the medication to a patient. The resource is called "MedicationRequest" rather than "MedicationPrescription" or "MedicationOrder" to generalize the use across inpatient and outpatient settings, including care plans, etc., and to harmonize with workflow patterns.

The `US-Core-MedicationRequest` FHIR [implementation guide](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/index.html) contains complete details.  

Reference the FHIR specification for detailed [US-Core-MedicationRequest](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-medicationrequest-definitions.html) and  [HL7 Bundle](https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/bundle.html) attribute descriptions. Success response will be HL7 `Bundle` with `MedicationRequest` resource type of `US-Core-MedicationRequest`.

The `Observation` FHIR [implementation guide](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/index.html) contains complete details of the below profiles,


1. US Core Pediatric BMI for Age Observation

3. US Core Pulse Oximetry
4. US Core Smoking Status Observation
5. US Core Laboratory Result Observation
6. US Core Pediatric Head Occipital-frontal Circumference Percentile Profile


The [US Core Pediatric BMI for Age Observation](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-pediatric-bmi-for-age.html) profile sets minimum expectations for the Observation resource to record, search, and fetch pediatric body mass index (BMI) per age and gender observations associated with a patient. It is based on the FHIR Vital Signs Profile and identifies the additional mandatory core elements, extensions, vocabularies and value sets which SHALL be present in the Observation resource when using this profile.

Reference the FHIR specification for detailed `US Core Pediatric BMI for Age Observation` [attribute descriptions](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-pediatric-bmi-for-age-definitions.html) and [sample response](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/Observation-pediatric-bmi-example.json.html)



The [US Core Pediatric Weight for Height Observation](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-pediatric-weight-for-height.html) profile sets minimum expectations for the Observation resource to record, search, and fetch pediatric weight for height and age observations associated with a patient. It is based on the FHIR Vital Signs Profile and identifies the additional mandatory core elements, extensions, vocabularies and value sets which SHALL be present in the Observation resource when using this profile.

Reference the FHIR specification for detailed `US Core Pediatric Weight for Height Observation` [attribute descriptions](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-pediatric-weight-for-height-definitions.html) and [sample response](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/Observation-pediatric-wt-example.json.html).




The [US Core Pulse Oximetry](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-pulse-oximetry.html) profile sets minimum expectations for the Observation resource to record, search, and fetch pulse oximetry and inspired oxygen observations associated with a patient. It is based on the FHIR Vital Signs Profile and identifies the additional mandatory core elements, extensions, vocabularies and value sets which SHALL be present in the Observation resource when using this profile.

Reference the FHIR specification for detailed `US Core Pulse Oximetry` [attribute descriptions](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-pulse-oximetry-definitions.html) and [sample response](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/Observation-satO2-fiO2.json.html).


The [US Core Smoking Status Observation](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-smokingstatus.html) profile sets minimum expectations for the Observation resource to record, search, and fetch smoking status data associated with a patient. It identifies which core elements, extensions, vocabularies and value sets SHALL be present in the resource when using this profile.

A [US Core Laboratory Result Observation](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-observation-lab.html) is measurements and simple assertions made about a patient, device or other subject.

Reference the FHIR specification for detailed `US Core Laboratory Result Observation` [attribute descriptions](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-observation-lab-definitions.html) and [sample response](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/Observation-blood-glucose.json.html)

The `US-Core-DiagnosticReport` FHIR [implementation guide](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/index.html) contains complete details of the below profiles,


1. US-Core-DiagnosticReport-Note
2. US-Core-DiagnosticReport-Lab

A [US-Core-DiagnosticReport-Note](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-diagnosticreport-note.html) is the findings and interpretation of diagnostic tests performed on patients, groups of patients, devices, and locations, and/or specimens derived from these. The report includes clinical context such as requesting and provider information, and some mix of atomic results, images, textual and coded interpretations, and formatted representation of diagnostic reports.

Reference the FHIR specification for detailed `US-Core-DiagnosticReport-Note` [attribute descriptions](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-diagnosticreport-note-definitions.html) and [sample response](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/DiagnosticReport-cardiology-report.json.html).

A [US-Core-DiagnosticReport-Lab](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-diagnosticreport-lab.html) Laboratory results are grouped and summarized using the DiagnosticReport resource which typically reference Observation resource(s). Each Observation resource represents an individual laboratory test and result value or component result values, or a “nested” panel (such as a microbial susceptibility panel) which references other observations. They can also be presented in report form or as free text. 

Reference the FHIR specification for detailed `US-Core-DiagnosticReport-Lab` [attribute descriptions](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-diagnosticreport-lab-definitions.html) and [sample response](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/DiagnosticReport-urinalysis.json.html).

The `US-Core-Goal` FHIR [Implementation Guide](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/) contains complete details.

The [US-Core-PractitionerRole](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-practitionerrole.html) describes details about a provider, which can be a practitioner or an organization. When the provider is a practitioner, there may be a relationship to an organization. A provider renders services to patients at a location. When the provider is a practitioner, there may also be a relationship to an organization. Practitioner participation in healthcare provider insurance networks may be direct or through their role at an organization.

The `US-Core-PractitionerRole` FHIR [implementation Guide](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/index.html) contains complete details.

Reference the FHIR specification for detailed `US-Core-PractitionerRole` [attribute descriptions](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-practitionerrole-definitions.html) and [sample response](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/Bundle-66c8856b-ba11-4876-8aa8-467aad8c11a2.json.html).

A [US-Core-DocumentReference](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-documentreference.html) resource is used to index a document, clinical note, and other binary objects to make them available to a healthcare system. A document is some sequence of bytes that is identifiable, establishes its own context (e.g., what subject, author, etc. can be displayed to the user), and has defined update management. The DocumentReference resource can be used with any document format that has a recognized mime type and that conforms to this definition.

The `US-Core-DocumentReference` FHIR [Implementation Guide](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/index.html) contains complete details.  

Reference the FHIR specification for detailed `US-Core-DocumentReference` [attribute descriptions](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-documentreference-definitions.html) and [sample response](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/DocumentReference-episode-summary.json.html#).

allOf.description: An interaction between a patient and healthcare provider(s) for the purpose of providing healthcare service(s) or assessing the health status of a patient.

identifier.description: Identifier(s) by which this encounter is known.

status.description: planned | arrived | triaged | in-progress | onleave | finished | cancelled +.

statusHistory.description: The status history permits the encounter resource to contain the status history without needing to read through the historical versions of the resource, or even have the server store them.

classHistory.description:
The class history permits the tracking of the encounters transitions without needing to go  through the resource history.

This would be used for a case where an admission starts of as an emergency encounter, then transisions into an inpatient scenario. Doing this and not restarting a new encounter ensures that any lab/diagnostic results can more easily follow the patient and not require re-processing and not get lost or cancelled during a kindof discharge from emergency to inpatient.

type.description: Specific type of encounter (e.g. e-mail consultation, surgical day-care, skilled nursing, rehabilitation).

priority.description: Indicates the urgency of the encounter.

subject.description: The patient ro group present at the encounter.

episodeOfCare.description: Where a specific encounter should be classified as a part of a specific episode(s) of care this field should be used. This association can facilitate grouping of related encounters together for a specific purpose, such as government reporting, issue tracking, association via a common problem.  The association is recorded on the encounter as these are typically created after the episode of care, and grouped on entry rather than editing the episode of care to append another encounter to it (the episode of care could span years).

incomingReferral.description: The referral request this encounter satisfies (incoming referral).

participant.description: The list of people responsible for providing the service.

appointment.description: The appointment that scheduled this encounter.

period.description: The start and end time of the encounter.

length.description: Quantity of time the encounter lasted. This excludes the time during leaves of absence.

reason.description: Reason the encounter takes place, expressed as a code. For admissions, this can be used for a coded admission diagnosis.

diagnosis.description: The list of diagnosis relevant to this encounter.

account.description: The set of accounts that may be used for billing for this Encounter.

hospitalization.description: Details about the admission to a healthcare service.

location.description: List of locations where  the patient has been during this encounter.

serviceProvider.description: An organization that is in charge of maintaining the information of this Encounter (e.g. who maintains the report or the master service catalog item, etc.). This MAY be the same as the organization on the Patient record, however it could be different. This MAY not be not the Service Delivery Location's Organization.

partOf.description: Another Encounter of which this encounter is a part of (administratively or in time).

allOf.description: An interaction between a patient and healthcare provider(s) for the purpose of providing healthcare service(s) or assessing the health status of a patient.

status.description: planned | arrived | triaged | in-progress | onleave | finished | cancelled +.

period.description: The time that the episode was in the specified status.

allOf.description: An interaction between a patient and healthcare provider(s) for the purpose of providing healthcare service(s) or assessing the health status of a patient.

period.description: The time that the episode was in the specified class.

allOf.description: An interaction between a patient and healthcare provider(s) for the purpose of providing healthcare service(s) or assessing the health status of a patient.

type.description: Role of participant in encounter.

period.description: The period of time that the specified participant participated in the encounter. These can overlap or be sub-sets of the overall encounter's period.

individual.description: Persons involved in the encounter other than the patient.

allOf.description: An interaction between a patient and healthcare provider(s) for the purpose of providing healthcare service(s) or assessing the health status of a patient.

condition.description: Reason the encounter takes place, as specified using information from another resource. For admissions, this is the admission diagnosis. The indication will typically be a Condition (with other resources referenced in the evidence.detail), or a Procedure.

role.description: Role that this diagnosis has within the encounter (e.g. admission, billing, discharge …).

rank.description: Ranking of the diagnosis (for each role type).

allOf.description: An interaction between a patient and healthcare provider(s) for the purpose of providing healthcare service(s) or assessing the health status of a patient.

origin.description: The location from which the patient came before admission.

admitSource.description: From where patient was admitted (physician referral, transfer).

reAdmission.description: Whether this hospitalization is a readmission and why if known.

dietPreference.description: Diet preferences reported by the patient.

specialArrangement.description: Any special requests that have been made for this hospitalization encounter, such as the provision of specific equipment or other things.

destination.description: Location to which the patient is discharged.

dischargeDisposition.description: Category or kind of location after discharge.

allOf.description: An interaction between a patient and healthcare provider(s) for the purpose of providing healthcare service(s) or assessing the health status of a patient.

location.description: The location where the encounter takes place.

status.description: The status of the participants' presence at the specified location during the period specified. If the participant is is no longer at the location, then the period will have an end date/time.

period.description: Time period during which the patient was present at the location.

allOf.description: An action that is or was performed on a patient. This can be a physical intervention like an operation, or less invasive like counseling or hypnotherapy.

identifier.description: This records identifiers associated with this procedure that are defined by business processes and/or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate (e.g. in CDA documents, or in written / printed documentation).

definition.description: A protocol, guideline, orderset or other definition that was adhered to in whole or in part by this procedure.

basedOn.description: A reference to a resource that contains details of the request for this procedure.

partOf.description: A larger event of which this particular procedure is a component or step.

status.description: A code specifying the state of the procedure. Generally this will be in-progress or completed state.

notDone.description: Set this to true if the record is saying that the procedure was NOT performed.

notDoneReason.description: A code indicating why the procedure was not performed.

category.description: A code that classifies the procedure for searching, sorting and display purposes (e.g. "Surgical Procedure").

code.description: The specific procedure that is performed. Use text if the exact nature of the procedure cannot be coded (e.g. "Laparoscopic Appendectomy").

subject.description: The person, animal or group on which the procedure was performed.

context.description: The encounter during which the procedure was performed.

performedDateTime.description: The date(time)/period over which the procedure was performed. Allows a period to support complex procedures that span more than one date, and also allows for the length of the procedure to be captured.

performedPeriod.description: The date(time)/period over which the procedure was performed. Allows a period to support complex procedures that span more than one date, and also allows for the length of the procedure to be captured.

performer.description: Limited to 'real' people rather than equipment.

location.description: The location where the procedure actually happened.  E.g. a newborn at home, a tracheostomy at a restaurant.

reasonCode.description: The coded reason why the procedure was performed. This may be coded entity of some type, or may simply be present as text.

reasonReference.description: The condition that is the reason why the procedure was performed.

bodySite.description: Detailed and structured anatomical location information. Multiple locations are allowed - e.g. multiple punch biopsies of a lesion.

outcome.description: The outcome of the procedure - did it resolve reasons for the procedure being performed?

report.description: This could be a histology result, pathology report, surgical report, etc..

complication.description: Any complications that occurred during the procedure, or in the immediate post-performance period. These are generally tracked separately from the notes, which will typically describe the procedure itself rather than any 'post procedure' issues.

complicationDetail.description: Any complications that occurred during the procedure, or in the immediate post-performance period.

followUp.description: If the procedure required specific follow up - e.g. removal of sutures. The followup may be represented as a simple note, or could potentially be more complex in which case the CarePlan resource can be used.

note.description: Any other notes about the procedure.  E.g. the operative notes.

focalDevice.description: A device that is implanted, removed or otherwise manipulated (calibration, battery replacement, fitting a prosthesis, attaching a wound-vac, etc.) as a focal portion of the Procedure.

usedReference.description: Identifies medications, devices and any other substance used as part of the procedure.

usedCode.description: Identifies coded items that were used as part of the procedure.

allOf.description: An action that is or was performed on a patient. This can be a physical intervention like an operation, or less invasive like counseling or hypnotherapy.

actor.description: The practitioner who was involved in the procedure.

onBehalfOf.description: The organization the device or practitioner was acting on behalf of.

allOf.description: An action that is or was performed on a patient. This can be a physical intervention like an operation, or less invasive like counseling or hypnotherapy.

action.description: The kind of change that happened to the device during the procedure.

manipulated.description: The device that was manipulated (changed) during the procedure.

allOf.description: Financial instrument which may be used to reimburse or pay for health care products and services.

identifier.description: The main (and possibly only) identifier for the coverage - often referred to as a Member Id, Certificate number, Personal Health Number or Case ID. May be constructed as the concatination of the Coverage.SubscriberID and the Coverage.dependant.

status.description: The status of the resource instance.

type.description: The type of coverage: social program, medical plan, accident coverage (workers compensation, auto), group health or payment by an individual or organization.

policyHolder.description: The party who 'owns' the insurance policy,  may be an individual, corporation or the subscriber's employer.

subscriber.description: The party who has signed-up for or 'owns' the contractual relationship to the policy or to whom the benefit of the policy for services rendered to them or their family is due.

subscriberId.description: The insurer assigned ID for the Subscriber.

beneficiary.description: The party who benefits from the insurance coverage., the patient when services are provided.

relationship.description: The relationship of beneficiary (patient) to the subscriber.

period.description: Time period during which the coverage is in force. A missing start date indicates the start date isn't known, a missing end date means the coverage is continuing to be in force.

payor.description: The program or plan underwriter or payor including both insurance and non-insurance agreements, such as patient-pay agreements. May provide multiple identifiers such as insurance company identifier or business identifier (BIN number).

grouping.description: A suite of underwrite specific classifiers, for example may be used to identify a class of coverage or employer group, Policy, Plan.

dependent.description: A unique identifier for a dependent under the coverage.

sequence.description: An optional counter for a particular instance of the identified coverage which increments upon each renewal.

order.description: The order of applicability of this coverage relative to other coverages which are currently inforce. Note, there may be gaps in the numbering and this does not imply primary, secondard etc. as the specific positioning of coverages depends upon the episode of care.

network.description: The insurer-specific identifier for the insurer-defined network of providers to which the beneficiary may seek treatment which will be covered at the 'in-network' rate, otherwise 'out of network' terms and conditions apply.

contract.description: The policy(s) which constitute this insurance coverage.

allOf.description: Financial instrument which may be used to reimburse or pay for health care products and services.

group.description: Identifies a style or collective of coverage issued by the underwriter, for example may be used to identify an employer group. May also be referred to as a Policy or Group ID.

groupDisplay.description: A short description for the group.

subGroup.description: Identifies a style or collective of coverage issued by the underwriter, for example may be used to identify a subset of an employer group.

subGroupDisplay.description: A short description for the subgroup.

plan.description: Identifies a style or collective of coverage issued by the underwriter, for example may be used to identify a collection of benefits provided to employees. May be referred to as a Section or Division ID.

planDisplay.description: A short description for the plan.

subPlan.description: Identifies a sub-style or sub-collective of coverage issued by the underwriter, for example may be used to identify a subset of a collection of benefits provided to employees.

subPlanDisplay.description: A short description for the subplan.

class.description: Identifies a style or collective of coverage issues by the underwriter, for example may be used to identify a class of coverage such as a level of deductables or co-payment.

classDisplay.description: A short description for the class.

subClass.description: Identifies a sub-style or sub-collective of coverage issues by the underwriter, for example may be used to identify a subclass of coverage such as a sub-level of deductables or co-payment.

subClassDisplay.description: A short description for the subclass.

allOf.description: The findings and interpretation of diagnostic  tests performed on patients, groups of patients, devices, and locations, and/or specimens derived from these. The report includes clinical context such as requesting and provider information, and some mix of atomic results, images, textual and coded interpretations, and formatted representation of diagnostic reports.

identifier.description: Identifiers assigned to this report by the performer or other systems.

basedOn.description: Details concerning a test or procedure requested.

status.description: The status of the diagnostic report as a whole.

category.description: A code that classifies the clinical discipline, department or diagnostic service that created the report (e.g. cardiology, biochemistry, hematology, MRI). This is used for searching, sorting and display purposes.

code.description: A code or name that describes this diagnostic report.

subject.description: The subject of the report. Usually, but not always, this is a patient. However diagnostic services also perform analyses on specimens collected from a variety of other sources.

context.description: The healthcare event  (e.g. a patient and healthcare provider interaction) which this DiagnosticReport per is about.

effectiveDateTime.description: The time or time-period the observed values are related to. When the subject of the report is a patient, this is usually either the time of the procedure or of specimen collection(s), but very often the source of the date/time is not known, only the date/time itself.

effectivePeriod.description: The time or time-period the observed values are related to. When the subject of the report is a patient, this is usually either the time of the procedure or of specimen collection(s), but very often the source of the date/time is not known, only the date/time itself.

issued.description: The date and time that this version of the report was released from the source diagnostic service.

performer.description: Indicates who or what participated in producing the report.

specimen.description: Details about the specimens on which this diagnostic report is based.

result.description: Observations that are part of this diagnostic report. Observations can be simple name/value pairs (e.g. "atomic" results), or they can be grouping observations that include references to other members of the group (e.g. "panels").

imagingStudy.description: One or more links to full details of any imaging performed during the diagnostic investigation. Typically, this is imaging performed by DICOM enabled modalities, but this is not required. A fully enabled PACS viewer can use this information to provide views of the source images.

image.description: A list of key images associated with this report. The images are generally created during the diagnostic process, and may be directly of the patient, or of treated specimens (i.e. slides of interest).

conclusion.description: Concise and clinically contextualized impression / summary of the diagnostic report.

presentedForm.description: Rich text representation of the entire result as issued by the diagnostic service. Multiple formats are allowed but they SHALL be semantically equivalent.

allOf.description: The findings and interpretation of diagnostic  tests performed on patients, groups of patients, devices, and locations, and/or specimens derived from these. The report includes clinical context such as requesting and provider information, and some mix of atomic results, images, textual and coded interpretations, and formatted representation of diagnostic reports.

role.description: Describes the type of participation (e.g.  a responsible party, author, or verifier).

actor.description: The reference to the  practitioner or organization involved in producing the report. For example, the diagnostic service that is responsible for issuing the report.

allOf.description: The findings and interpretation of diagnostic  tests performed on patients, groups of patients, devices, and locations, and/or specimens derived from these. The report includes clinical context such as requesting and provider information, and some mix of atomic results, images, textual and coded interpretations, and formatted representation of diagnostic reports.

comment.description: A comment about the image. Typically, this is used to provide an explanation for why the image is included, or to draw the viewer's attention to important features.

allOf.description: This resource is primarily used for the identification and definition of a medication. It covers the ingredients and the packaging for a medication.

code.description: A code (or set of codes) that specify this medication, or a textual description if no code is available. Usage note: This could be a standard medication code such as a code from RxNorm, SNOMED CT, IDMP etc. It could also be a national or local formulary code, optionally with translations to other code systems.

status.description: A code to indicate if the medication is in active use.

isBrand.description: Set to true if the item is attributable to a specific manufacturer.

isOverTheCounter.description: Set to true if the medication can be obtained without an order from a prescriber.

manufacturer.description: Describes the details of the manufacturer of the medication product.  This is not intended to represent the distributor of a medication product.

form.description: Describes the form of the item.  Powder; tablets; capsule.

ingredient.description: Identifies a particular constituent of interest in the product.

package.description: Information that only applies to packages (not products).

image.description: Photo(s) or graphic representation(s) of the medication.

allOf.description: This resource is primarily used for the identification and definition of a medication. It covers the ingredients and the packaging for a medication.

itemCodeableConcept.description: The actual ingredient - either a substance (simple ingredient) or another medication.

itemReference.description: The actual ingredient - either a substance (simple ingredient) or another medication.

isActive.description: Indication of whether this ingredient affects the therapeutic action of the drug.

amount.description: Specifies how many (or how much) of the items there are in this Medication.  For example, 250 mg per tablet.  This is expressed as a ratio where the numerator is 250mg and the denominator is 1 tablet.

allOf.description: This resource is primarily used for the identification and definition of a medication. It covers the ingredients and the packaging for a medication.

container.description: The kind of container that this package comes as.

content.description: A set of components that go to make up the described item.

batch.description: Information about a group of medication produced or packaged from one production run.

allOf.description: This resource is primarily used for the identification and definition of a medication. It covers the ingredients and the packaging for a medication.

itemCodeableConcept.description: Identifies one of the items in the package.

itemReference.description: Identifies one of the items in the package.

amount.description: The amount of the product that is in the package.

allOf.description: This resource is primarily used for the identification and definition of a medication. It covers the ingredients and the packaging for a medication.

lotNumber.description: The assigned lot number of a batch of the specified product.

expirationDate.description: When this specific batch of product will expire.

allOf.description: Risk of harmful or undesirable, physiological response which is unique to an individual and associated with exposure to a substance.

identifier.description: This records identifiers associated with this allergy/intolerance concern that are defined by business processes and/or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate (e.g. in CDA documents, or in written / printed documentation).

clinicalStatus.description: The clinical status of the allergy or intolerance.

verificationStatus.description: Assertion about certainty associated with the propensity, or potential risk, of a reaction to the identified substance (including pharmaceutical product).

type.description: Identification of the underlying physiological mechanism for the reaction risk.

criticality.description: Estimate of the potential clinical harm, or seriousness, of the reaction to the identified substance.

code.description: Code for an allergy or intolerance statement (either a positive or a negated/excluded statement).  This may be a code for a substance or pharmaceutical product that is considered to be responsible for the adverse reaction risk (e.g., "Latex"), an allergy or intolerance condition (e.g., "Latex allergy"), or a negated/excluded code for a specific substance or class (e.g., "No latex allergy") or a general or categorical negated statement (e.g.,  "No known allergy", "No known drug allergies").

patient.description: The patient who has the allergy or intolerance.

onsetDateTime.description: Estimated or actual date,  date-time, or age when allergy or intolerance was identified.

onsetAge.description: Estimated or actual date,  date-time, or age when allergy or intolerance was identified.

onsetPeriod.description: Estimated or actual date,  date-time, or age when allergy or intolerance was identified.

onsetRange.description: Estimated or actual date,  date-time, or age when allergy or intolerance was identified.

onsetString.description: Estimated or actual date,  date-time, or age when allergy or intolerance was identified.

assertedDate.description: The date on which the existance of the AllergyIntolerance was first asserted or acknowledged.

recorder.description: Individual who recorded the record and takes responsibility for its content.

asserter.description: The source of the information about the allergy that is recorded.

lastOccurrence.description: Represents the date and/or time of the last known occurrence of a reaction event.

note.description: Additional narrative about the propensity for the Adverse Reaction, not captured in other fields.

reaction.description: Details about each adverse reaction event linked to exposure to the identified substance.

allOf.description: Risk of harmful or undesirable, physiological response which is unique to an individual and associated with exposure to a substance.

substance.description: Identification of the specific substance (or pharmaceutical product) considered to be responsible for the Adverse Reaction event. Note: the substance for a specific reaction may be different from the substance identified as the cause of the risk, but it must be consistent with it. For instance, it may be a more specific substance (e.g. a brand medication) or a composite product that includes the identified substance. It must be clinically safe to only process the 'code' and ignore the 'reaction.substance'.

manifestation.description: Clinical symptoms and/or signs that are observed or associated with the adverse reaction event.

description.description: Text description about the reaction as a whole, including details of the manifestation if required.

onset.description: Record of the date and/or time of the onset of the Reaction.

severity.description: Clinical assessment of the severity of the reaction event as a whole, potentially considering multiple different manifestations.

exposureRoute.description: Identification of the route by which the subject was exposed to the substance.

note.description: Additional text about the adverse reaction event not captured in other fields.

allOf.description: This resource identifies an instance or a type of a manufactured item that is used in the provision of healthcare without being substantially changed through that activity. The device may be a medical or non-medical device.  Medical devices include durable (reusable) medical equipment, implantable devices, as well as disposable equipment used for diagnostic, treatment, and research for healthcare and public health.  Non-medical devices may include items such as a machine, cellphone, computer, application, etc.

identifier.description: Unique instance identifiers assigned to a device by manufacturers other organizations or owners.

udi.description: [Unique device identifier (UDI)](device.html#5.11.3.2.2) assigned to device label or package.

type.description: Code or identifier to identify a kind of device.

lotNumber.description: Lot number assigned by the manufacturer.

manufactureDate.description: The date and time when the device was manufactured.

expirationDate.description: The date and time beyond which this device is no longer valid or should not be used (if applicable).

model.description: The "model" is an identifier assigned by the manufacturer to identify the product by its type. This number is shared by the all devices sold as the same type.

version.description: The version of the device, if the device has multiple releases under the same model, or if the device is software or carries firmware.

patient.description: Patient information, If the device is affixed to a person.

owner.description: An organization that is responsible for the provision and ongoing maintenance of the device.

contact.description: Contact details for an organization or a particular human that is responsible for the device.

location.description: The place where the device can be found.

url.description: A network address on which the device may be contacted directly.

note.description: Descriptive information, usage information or implantation information that is not captured in an existing element.

safety.description: Provides additional safety characteristics about a medical device.  For example devices containing latex.

allOf.description: This resource identifies an instance or a type of a manufactured item that is used in the provision of healthcare without being substantially changed through that activity. The device may be a medical or non-medical device.  Medical devices include durable (reusable) medical equipment, implantable devices, as well as disposable equipment used for diagnostic, treatment, and research for healthcare and public health.  Non-medical devices may include items such as a machine, cellphone, computer, application, etc.

deviceIdentifier.description: The device identifier (DI) is a mandatory, fixed portion of a UDI that identifies the labeler and the specific version or model of a device.

name.description: Name of device as used in labeling or catalog.

jurisdiction.description: The identity of the authoritative source for UDI generation within a  jurisdiction.  All UDIs are globally unique within a single namespace. with the appropriate repository uri as the system.  For example,  UDIs of devices managed in the U.S. by the FDA, the value is  http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/fda-udi.

carrierHRF.description: The full UDI carrier as the human readable form (HRF) representation of the barcode string as printed on the packaging of the device.

carrierAIDC.description: The full UDI carrier of the Automatic Identification and Data Capture (AIDC) technology representation of the barcode string as printed on the packaging of the device - E.g a barcode or RFID.   Because of limitations on character sets in XML and the need to round-trip JSON data through XML, AIDC Formats *SHALL* be base64 encoded.

issuer.description:
Organization that is charged with issuing UDIs for devices.  For example, the US FDA issuers include :
1) GS1: 
http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/gs1-di, 
2) HIBCC:
http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/hibcc-dI, 
3) ICCBBA for blood containers:
http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/iccbba-blood-di, 
4) ICCBA for other devices:
http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/iccbba-other-di.

entryType.description: A coded entry to indicate how the data was entered.

Example 1.description: see http://hl7.org/fhir/json.html#schema for information about the FHIR Json Schemas

allOf.description: The Care Team includes all the people and organizations who plan to participate in the coordination and delivery of care for a patient.

identifier.description: This records identifiers associated with this care team that are defined by business processes and/or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate.

status.description: Indicates the current state of the care team.

category.description: Identifies what kind of team.  This is to support differentiation between multiple co-existing teams, such as care plan team, episode of care team, longitudinal care team.

name.description: A label for human use intended to distinguish like teams.  E.g. the "red" vs. "green" trauma teams.

subject.description: Identifies the patient or group whose intended care is handled by the team.

context.description: The encounter or episode of care that establishes the context for this care team.

period.description: Indicates when the team did (or is intended to) come into effect and end.

participant.description: Identifies all people and organizations who are expected to be involved in the care team.

reasonCode.description: Describes why the care team exists.

reasonReference.description: Condition(s) that this care team addresses.

managingOrganization.description: The organization responsible for the care team.

allOf.description: The Care Team includes all the people and organizations who plan to participate in the coordination and delivery of care for a patient.

role.description: Indicates specific responsibility of an individual within the care team, such as "Primary care physician", "Trained social worker counselor", "Caregiver", etc.

member.description: The specific person or organization who is participating/expected to participate in the care team.

period.description: Indicates when the specific member or organization did (or is intended to) come into effect and end.

Example 1.description: see http://hl7.org/fhir/json.html#schema for information about the FHIR Json Schemas

allOf.description: A formally or informally recognized grouping of people or organizations formed for the purpose of achieving some form of collective action.  Includes companies, institutions, corporations, departments, community groups, healthcare practice groups, etc.

identifier.description: Identifier for the organization that is used to identify the organization across multiple disparate systems.

active.description: Whether the organization's record is still in active use.

type.description: The kind(s) of organization that this is.

name.description: A name associated with the organization.

alias.description: A list of alternate names that the organization is known as, or was known as in the past.

telecom.description: A contact detail for the organization.

partOf.description: The organization of which this organization forms a part.

contact.description: Contact for the organization for a certain purpose.

endpoint.description: Technical endpoints providing access to services operated for the organization.

allOf.description: A formally or informally recognized grouping of people or organizations formed for the purpose of achieving some form of collective action.  Includes companies, institutions, corporations, departments, community groups, healthcare practice groups, etc.

purpose.description: Indicates a purpose for which the contact can be reached.

name.description: A name associated with the contact.

telecom.description: A contact detail (e.g. a telephone number or an email address) by which the party may be contacted.

address.description: Visiting or postal addresses for the contact.

allOf.description: Describes the event of a patient being administered a vaccination or a record of a vaccination as reported by a patient, a clinician or another party and may include vaccine reaction information and what vaccination protocol was followed.

identifier.description: A unique identifier assigned to this immunization record.

status.description: Indicates the current status of the vaccination event.

notGiven.description: Indicates if the vaccination was or was not given.

vaccineCode.description: Vaccine that was administered or was to be administered.

patient.description: The patient who either received or did not receive the immunization.

encounter.description: The visit or admission or other contact between patient and health care provider the immunization was performed as part of.

date.description: Date vaccine administered or was to be administered.

primarySource.description: An indication that the content of the record is based on information from the person who administered the vaccine. This reflects the context under which the data was originally recorded.

reportOrigin.description: The source of the data when the report of the immunization event is not based on information from the person who administered the vaccine.

location.description: The service delivery location where the vaccine administration occurred.

lotNumber.description: Lot number of the  vaccine product.

site.description: Body site where vaccine was administered.

route.description: The path by which the vaccine product is taken into the body.

doseQuantity.description: The quantity of vaccine product that was administered.

practitioner.description: Indicates who or what performed the event.

note.description: Extra information about the immunization that is not conveyed by the other attributes.

explanation.description: Reasons why a vaccine was or was not administered.

reaction.description: Categorical data indicating that an adverse event is associated in time to an immunization.

vaccinationProtocol.description: Contains information about the protocol(s) under which the vaccine was administered.

allOf.description: Describes the event of a patient being administered a vaccination or a record of a vaccination as reported by a patient, a clinician or another party and may include vaccine reaction information and what vaccination protocol was followed.

role.description: Describes the type of performance (e.g. ordering provider, administering provider, etc.).

actor.description: The device, practitioner, etc. who performed the action.

allOf.description: Describes the event of a patient being administered a vaccination or a record of a vaccination as reported by a patient, a clinician or another party and may include vaccine reaction information and what vaccination protocol was followed.

reason.description: Reasons why a vaccine was administered.

reasonNotGiven.description: Reason why a vaccine was not administered.

allOf.description: Describes the event of a patient being administered a vaccination or a record of a vaccination as reported by a patient, a clinician or another party and may include vaccine reaction information and what vaccination protocol was followed.

date.description: Date of reaction to the immunization.

allOf.description: Describes the event of a patient being administered a vaccination or a record of a vaccination as reported by a patient, a clinician or another party and may include vaccine reaction information and what vaccination protocol was followed.

description.description: Contains the description about the protocol under which the vaccine was administered.

authority.description: Indicates the authority who published the protocol.  E.g. ACIP.

series.description: One possible path to achieve presumed immunity against a disease - within the context of an authority.

seriesDoses.description: The recommended number of doses to achieve immunity.

doseStatus.description: Indicates if the immunization event should "count" against  the protocol.

doseStatusReason.description: Provides an explanation as to why an immunization event should or should not count against the protocol.

allOf.description: Describes the intention of how one or more practitioners intend to deliver care for a particular patient, group or community for a period of time, possibly limited to care for a specific condition or set of conditions.

identifier.description: This records identifiers associated with this care plan that are defined by business processes and/or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate (e.g. in CDA documents, or in written / printed documentation).

definition.description: Identifies the protocol, questionnaire, guideline or other specification the care plan should be conducted in accordance with.

basedOn.description: A care plan that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this care plan.

replaces.description: Completed or terminated care plan whose function is taken by this new care plan.

partOf.description: A larger care plan of which this particular care plan is a component or step.

status.description: Indicates whether the plan is currently being acted upon, represents future intentions or is now a historical record.

intent.description: Indicates the level of authority/intentionality associated with the care plan and where the care plan fits into the workflow chain.

category.description: Identifies what "kind" of plan this is to support differentiation between multiple co-existing plans; e.g. "Home health", "psychiatric", "asthma", "disease management", "wellness plan", etc.

description.description: A description of the scope and nature of the plan.

subject.description: Identifies the patient or group whose intended care is described by the plan.

context.description: Identifies the original context in which this particular CarePlan was created.

period.description: Indicates when the plan did (or is intended to) come into effect and end.

author.description: Identifies the individual(s) or ogranization who is responsible for the content of the care plan.

careTeam.description: Identifies all people and organizations who are expected to be involved in the care envisioned by this plan.

addresses.description: Identifies the conditions/problems/concerns/diagnoses/etc. whose management and/or mitigation are handled by this plan.

supportingInfo.description: Identifies portions of the patient's record that specifically influenced the formation of the plan.  These might include co-morbidities, recent procedures, limitations, recent assessments, etc.

goal.description: Describes the intended objective(s) of carrying out the care plan.

activity.description: Identifies a planned action to occur as part of the plan.  For example, a medication to be used, lab tests to perform, self-monitoring, education, etc.

note.description: General notes about the care plan not covered elsewhere.

allOf.description: Describes the intention of how one or more practitioners intend to deliver care for a particular patient, group or community for a period of time, possibly limited to care for a specific condition or set of conditions.

outcomeCodeableConcept.description: Identifies the outcome at the point when the status of the activity is assessed.  For example, the outcome of an education activity could be patient understands (or not).

outcomeReference.description: Details of the outcome or action resulting from the activity.  The reference to an "event" resource, such as Procedure or Encounter or Observation, is the result/outcome of the activity itself.  The activity can be conveyed using CarePlan.activity.detail OR using the CarePlan.activity.reference (a reference to a “request” resource).

progress.description: Notes about the adherence/status/progress of the activity.

reference.description: The details of the proposed activity represented in a specific resource.

detail.description: A simple summary of a planned activity suitable for a general care plan system (e.g. form driven) that doesn't know about specific resources such as procedure etc.

allOf.description: Describes the intention of how one or more practitioners intend to deliver care for a particular patient, group or community for a period of time, possibly limited to care for a specific condition or set of conditions.

category.description: High-level categorization of the type of activity in a care plan.

definition.description: Identifies the protocol, questionnaire, guideline or other specification the planned activity should be conducted in accordance with.

code.description: Detailed description of the type of planned activity; e.g. What lab test, what procedure, what kind of encounter.

reasonCode.description: Provides the rationale that drove the inclusion of this particular activity as part of the plan or the reason why the activity was prohibited.

reasonReference.description: Provides the health condition(s) that drove the inclusion of this particular activity as part of the plan.

goal.description: Internal reference that identifies the goals that this activity is intended to contribute towards meeting.

status.description: Identifies what progress is being made for the specific activity.

statusReason.description: Provides reason why the activity isn't yet started, is on hold, was cancelled, etc.

prohibited.description: If true, indicates that the described activity is one that must NOT be engaged in when following the plan.  If false, indicates that the described activity is one that should be engaged in when following the plan.

scheduledTiming.description: The period, timing or frequency upon which the described activity is to occur.

scheduledPeriod.description: The period, timing or frequency upon which the described activity is to occur.

scheduledString.description: The period, timing or frequency upon which the described activity is to occur.

location.description: Identifies the facility where the activity will occur; e.g. home, hospital, specific clinic, etc.

performer.description: Identifies who's expected to be involved in the activity.

productCodeableConcept.description: Identifies the food, drug or other product to be consumed or supplied in the activity.

productReference.description: Identifies the food, drug or other product to be consumed or supplied in the activity.

dailyAmount.description: Identifies the quantity expected to be consumed in a given day.

quantity.description: Identifies the quantity expected to be supplied, administered or consumed by the subject.

description.description: This provides a textual description of constraints on the intended activity occurrence, including relation to other activities.  It may also include objectives, pre-conditions and end-conditions.  Finally, it may convey specifics about the activity such as body site, method, route, etc.

Example 1.description: see http://hl7.org/fhir/json.html#schema for information about the FHIR Json Schemas

allOf.description: A clinical condition, problem, diagnosis, or other event, situation, issue, or clinical concept that has risen to a level of concern.

identifier.description: This records identifiers associated with this condition that are defined by business processes and/or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate (e.g. in CDA documents, or in written / printed documentation).

clinicalStatus.description: The clinical status of the condition.

verificationStatus.description: The verification status to support the clinical status of the condition.

category.description: A category assigned to the condition.

severity.description: A subjective assessment of the severity of the condition as evaluated by the clinician.

code.description: Identification of the condition, problem or diagnosis.

bodySite.description: The anatomical location where this condition manifests itself.

subject.description: Indicates the patient or group who the condition record is associated with.

context.description: Encounter during which the condition was first asserted.

onsetDateTime.description: Estimated or actual date or date-time  the condition began, in the opinion of the clinician.

onsetAge.description: Estimated or actual date or date-time  the condition began, in the opinion of the clinician.

onsetPeriod.description: Estimated or actual date or date-time  the condition began, in the opinion of the clinician.

onsetRange.description: Estimated or actual date or date-time  the condition began, in the opinion of the clinician.

onsetString.description: Estimated or actual date or date-time  the condition began, in the opinion of the clinician.

abatementDateTime.description: The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission. This is called "abatement" because of the many overloaded connotations associated with "remission" or "resolution" - Conditions are never really resolved, but they can abate.

abatementAge.description: The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission. This is called "abatement" because of the many overloaded connotations associated with "remission" or "resolution" - Conditions are never really resolved, but they can abate.

abatementBoolean.description: The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission. This is called "abatement" because of the many overloaded connotations associated with "remission" or "resolution" - Conditions are never really resolved, but they can abate.

abatementPeriod.description: The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission. This is called "abatement" because of the many overloaded connotations associated with "remission" or "resolution" - Conditions are never really resolved, but they can abate.

abatementRange.description: The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission. This is called "abatement" because of the many overloaded connotations associated with "remission" or "resolution" - Conditions are never really resolved, but they can abate.

abatementString.description: The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission. This is called "abatement" because of the many overloaded connotations associated with "remission" or "resolution" - Conditions are never really resolved, but they can abate.

assertedDate.description: The date on which the existance of the Condition was first asserted or acknowledged.

asserter.description: Individual who is making the condition statement.

stage.description: Clinical stage or grade of a condition. May include formal severity assessments.

evidence.description: Supporting Evidence / manifestations that are the basis on which this condition is suspected or confirmed.

note.description: Additional information about the Condition. This is a general notes/comments entry  for description of the Condition, its diagnosis and prognosis.

allOf.description: A clinical condition, problem, diagnosis, or other event, situation, issue, or clinical concept that has risen to a level of concern.

summary.description: A simple summary of the stage such as "Stage 3". The determination of the stage is disease-specific.

assessment.description: Reference to a formal record of the evidence on which the staging assessment is based.

allOf.description: A clinical condition, problem, diagnosis, or other event, situation, issue, or clinical concept that has risen to a level of concern.

code.description: A manifestation or symptom that led to the recording of this condition.

detail.description: Links to other relevant information, including pathology reports.

allOf.description: An order or request for both supply of the medication and the instructions for administration of the medication to a patient. The resource is called "MedicationRequest" rather than "MedicationPrescription" or "MedicationOrder" to generalize the use across inpatient and outpatient settings, including care plans, etc., and to harmonize with workflow patterns.

identifier.description: This records identifiers associated with this medication request that are defined by business processes and/or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate. For example a re-imbursement system might issue its own id for each prescription that is created.  This is particularly important where FHIR only provides part of an entire workflow process where records must be tracked through an entire system.

definition.description: Protocol or definition followed by this request.

basedOn.description: A plan or request that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this medication request.

groupIdentifier.description: A shared identifier common to all requests that were authorized more or less simultaneously by a single author, representing the identifier of the requisition or prescription.

status.description: A code specifying the current state of the order.  Generally this will be active or completed state.

intent.description: Whether the request is a proposal, plan, or an original order.

category.description: Indicates the type of medication order and where the medication is expected to be consumed or administered.

priority.description: Indicates how quickly the Medication Request should be addressed with respect to other requests.

medicationCodeableConcept.description: Identifies the medication being requested. This is a link to a resource that represents the medication which may be the details of the medication or simply an attribute carrying a code that identifies the medication from a known list of medications.

medicationReference.description: Identifies the medication being requested. This is a link to a resource that represents the medication which may be the details of the medication or simply an attribute carrying a code that identifies the medication from a known list of medications.

subject.description: A link to a resource representing the person or set of individuals to whom the medication will be given.

context.description: A link to an encounter, or episode of care, that identifies the particular occurrence or set occurrences of contact between patient and health care provider.

supportingInformation.description: Include additional information (for example, patient height and weight) that supports the ordering of the medication.

authoredOn.description: The date (and perhaps time) when the prescription was initially written or authored on.

requester.description: The individual, organization or device that initiated the request and has responsibility for its activation.

recorder.description: The person who entered the order on behalf of another individual for example in the case of a verbal or a telephone order.

reasonCode.description: The reason or the indication for ordering the medication.

reasonReference.description: Condition or observation that supports why the medication was ordered.

note.description: Extra information about the prescription that could not be conveyed by the other attributes.

dosageInstruction.description: Indicates how the medication is to be used by the patient.

dispenseRequest.description: Indicates the specific details for the dispense or medication supply part of a medication request (also known as a Medication Prescription or Medication Order).  Note that this information is not always sent with the order.  There may be in some settings (e.g. hospitals) institutional or system support for completing the dispense details in the pharmacy department.

substitution.description: Indicates whether or not substitution can or should be part of the dispense. In some cases substitution must happen, in other cases substitution must not happen. This block explains the prescriber's intent. If nothing is specified substitution may be done.

priorPrescription.description: A link to a resource representing an earlier order related order or prescription.

detectedIssue.description: Indicates an actual or potential clinical issue with or between one or more active or proposed clinical actions for a patient; e.g. Drug-drug interaction, duplicate therapy, dosage alert etc.

eventHistory.description: Links to Provenance records for past versions of this resource or fulfilling request or event resources that identify key state transitions or updates that are likely to be relevant to a user looking at the current version of the resource.

allOf.description: An order or request for both supply of the medication and the instructions for administration of the medication to a patient. The resource is called "MedicationRequest" rather than "MedicationPrescription" or "MedicationOrder" to generalize the use across inpatient and outpatient settings, including care plans, etc., and to harmonize with workflow patterns.

agent.description: The healthcare professional responsible for authorizing the initial prescription.

onBehalfOf.description: The organization the device or practitioner was acting on behalf of.

allOf.description: An order or request for both supply of the medication and the instructions for administration of the medication to a patient. The resource is called "MedicationRequest" rather than "MedicationPrescription" or "MedicationOrder" to generalize the use across inpatient and outpatient settings, including care plans, etc., and to harmonize with workflow patterns.

validityPeriod.description: This indicates the validity period of a prescription (stale dating the Prescription).

numberOfRepeatsAllowed.description: An integer indicating the number of times, in addition to the original dispense, (aka refills or repeats) that the patient can receive the prescribed medication. Usage Notes: This integer does not include the original order dispense. This means that if an order indicates dispense 30 tablets plus "3 repeats", then the order can be dispensed a total of 4 times and the patient can receive a total of 120 tablets.

quantity.description: The amount that is to be dispensed for one fill.

expectedSupplyDuration.description: Identifies the period time over which the supplied product is expected to be used, or the length of time the dispense is expected to last.

performer.description: Indicates the intended dispensing Organization specified by the prescriber.

allOf.description: An order or request for both supply of the medication and the instructions for administration of the medication to a patient. The resource is called "MedicationRequest" rather than "MedicationPrescription" or "MedicationOrder" to generalize the use across inpatient and outpatient settings, including care plans, etc., and to harmonize with workflow patterns.

allowed.description: True if the prescriber allows a different drug to be dispensed from what was prescribed.

reason.description: Indicates the reason for the substitution, or why substitution must or must not be performed.
